emails.subject: Re: 2001 Margin Plan
emails.body:
Paula,

35 million is fine. Let's lock it in.

Phillip

emails.subject: Re: Re: 2001 Margin Plan
emails.body:
Phillip,

Confirmed â€” margin plan approved at $35M.

Paula

emails.subject: West Power Desk
emails.body:
Louise,

We need to restructure the West Power desk. Current setup isn't scaling. Let's discuss Monday.

John

emails.subject: CA Regulatory Issues
emails.body:
Jim,

We need a coordinated response to the California regulatory situation. Can you draft a strategy memo?

Richard

emails.subject: Re: CA Regulatory Issues
emails.body:
Richard,

Draft attached. Key points: engage FERC early, maintain current trading positions, prepare public statement.

Jim

decisions.summary: Hire 3 additional gas traders for West desk

emails.subject: New Traders
emails.body:
Matt,

With the new margin plan approved we have budget for 3 more gas traders. Start recruiting.

Phillip

decisions.summary: Migrate West Power to new risk system

emails.subject: Risk System Migration
emails.body:
Beth,

As part of the desk restructure, we need West Power on the new risk system by end of Q4. What's the timeline look like?

Louise

emails.subject: Re: Risk System Migration
emails.body:
Louise,

We can have a staging environment ready by Nov 1. Full migration by Dec 15 if we get the data team's support.

Beth

decisions.summary: File FERC complaint on CA price caps

emails.subject: FERC Filing
emails.body:
Sarah,

Per our regulatory strategy, please prepare the FERC complaint regarding CA price caps. We need this filed by end of month.

Richard

emails.subject: Trading Limits
emails.body:
Phillip,

New traders are onboarded. Requesting increased trading limits for Q1 to accommodate expanded desk.

Matt

emails.subject: Fwd: Trading Limits
emails.body:
John,

Approved the limit increase. New desk is fully staffed.

Phillip

decisions.summary: Deploy new risk dashboard for West Power

emails.subject: Risk Dashboard Live
emails.body:
Louise,

New risk dashboard is deployed and live for West Power. Migration complete.

Beth

decisions.summary: Engage outside counsel for FERC proceedings

emails.subject: Outside Counsel
emails.body:
Richard,

FERC has scheduled hearings for March. We should engage Bracewell & Patterson for representation.

Sarah

emails.subject: Re: Outside Counsel
emails.body:
Sarah,

Agreed. Engage them immediately. Budget approved.

Richard

decisions.summary: Set up gas trading analytics pipeline

emails.subject: Analytics Pipeline
emails.body:
Keith,

With expanded trading limits, we need better analytics. Can your team build a real-time pipeline for the gas desk?

Phillip

decisions.summary: Prepare testimony for FERC March hearings

emails.subject: FERC Testimony Prep
emails.body:
Jim,

Outside counsel needs our data on CA market prices for testimony. Can you coordinate with the trading desk?

Sarah

emails.subject: Re: FERC Testimony Prep
emails.body:
Sarah,

Data package ready. Includes 6 months of hourly price data and our analysis showing market prices were competitive.

Jim

emails.subject: Re: FERC Testimony Prep
emails.body:
Good work both. Make sure legal reviews everything before submission.

Richard

decisions.summary: Expand West Power desk to include renewables

emails.subject: Renewables Trading
emails.body:
John,

Now that the new risk system is live, I think we should expand West Power to include renewables trading. The infrastructure can handle it.

Louise
